message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.GR, cs.AI 

This paper deals with the problem of multi-view frame reconstruction using conditional Generative Adversarial Network (cGAN). The paper focuses on learning spatio-temporal representation of missing frames using corresponding frames from other overlapping cameras. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes an adversarial approach to learn the representation, which falls under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also deals with merging frames from different cameras, which falls under the sub-category of cs.MM (Multimedia). The paper also uses a weighted average to give more weight to representations learned from frames within the camera, which falls under the sub-category of cs.GR (Graphics). Finally, the paper uses deep learning techniques to achieve promising results, which falls under the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
